name: Torun
fun_fact: Fun fact: Torun is the birthplace of Nicolaus Copernicus and has been making pierniki (gingerbread) since the Middle Ages - the city's gingerbread recipe is so legendary that it's protected as a regional product, and there's even a gingerbread-themed beer brewed locally.

hero_dishes.name: Pierogi
hero_dishes.description: Traditional Polish dumplings filled with everything from potato and cheese to sauerkraut with mushrooms, or sweet fillings - fried or boiled
hero_dishes.origin_story: Pierogi are Poland's most iconic dish, and Torun takes them seriously. Each filling combination has been perfected over generations, with recipes passed down through families
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Pierogarnia Stary M≈Çyn (multiple locations - the ultimate pierogi experience), Kozackie Pierogi (authentic dumplings where tradition meets taste)

hero_dishes.name: ≈ªurek Soup
hero_dishes.description: Traditional sour rye soup with sausage, potatoes, and hard-boiled eggs - tangy, hearty, and warming
hero_dishes.origin_story: This fermented rye soup has been a Polish staple for centuries, originally a peasant dish that became beloved across all classes. The sour flavor comes from fermenting rye flour for days
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Kuranty (in Old Town square - visitors love their ≈ªurek), milk bars throughout the city

hero_dishes.name: Pierniki Toru≈Ñskie (Torun Gingerbread)
hero_dishes.description: Medieval spiced gingerbread cookies with intricate designs - some filled with jam or chocolate, others plain with honey and spices
hero_dishes.origin_story: Torun has been making gingerbread since the 13th century. The recipe is a closely guarded secret, and the tradition is so important that there's a gingerbread museum in the city
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Restauracja Piernicova (themed around gingerbread), local bakeries throughout Old Town

hero_dishes.name: Pork Knuckle and Roasted Duck
hero_dishes.description: Massive portions of slow-roasted meat - pork knuckle with crispy skin or duck with braised cabbage
hero_dishes.origin_story: These hearty dishes represent traditional Polish home cooking at its best - the kind of food that sustained people through harsh winters
